text.section:
Each individual whom the State, a county, or a local government appoints or employs as a plumbing inspector shall:
each year attend a continuing education course that the Board or, with the approval of the Board, a county or local government conducts; and
meet minimum standards that:
adequately ensure that the plumbing inspector is qualified to inspect in accordance with the State Plumbing Code;
are established:
by the county or local government in consultation with the Board; or
if there is no standard established by the county or local government, by the Board; and
are administered:
for a county or local government inspector, by the county or local government that appoints or employs the inspector; and
for a State inspector, by the State.
An individual may not have any financial interest in any plumbing business while employed by the State, a county, or any local government as a plumbing inspector.

section.section: On appointment or employment, the individual shall place the master plumber license, journey plumber license, or limited license on inactive status.
The Board may issue a plumbing inspector identification card to a plumbing inspector who has placed the appropriate license on inactive status.

On termination of the appointment or employment of an individual as a plumbing inspector, the Board shall reactivate the master plumber license, journey plumber license, or limited license of an individual who is on inactive status, without examination, if the individual:
makes a written request to the Board; and
pays to the Board a reactivation fee of:
$20, for a journey plumber or holder of a limited journey plumber license; or
$50, for a master plumber or holder of a limited master plumber license.

text.section: The Board may impose a reasonable fee to cover the costs of conducting the continuing education courses under subsection (a) of this section.
